projectGridLines.title: Harnessing Existing Datasets to Establish Causal Pathways and Advance Action on Climate and Health for Urban India
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

While cities and urban activities are key contributors to climate change, they also face the highest risks due to climate change-associated hazards. Despite this, there is limited understanding and knowledge of climate change and its consequences on human health, especially in the context of urban India. This project will focus on developing the climate-health data architecture by consolidating and harnessing existing, publicly available datasets related to health outcomes, health surveillance, meteorological, social determinants, and socio-demographics - to establish causal pathways for climate change and health. It will focus on urban India, and within it, depending on the availability of urban and city-level disaggregated data, deep dive into vulnerable pockets of the city. In the final phase, efforts will be directed toward integrating the climate health data system with the Government of Indiaâ€™s National Data Analytics Portal (NDAP), as a use case.


Skill sets:

  • Well-versed with data cleaning, sorting, and reporting tools like Excel, Tableau, SQL, etc
  • Advanced statistical analysis
  • Data visualization
  • Proficiency with R, Python, or any other statistical programming languages
  • Applying GIS tools and working with a variety of climate, health, and socioeconomic datasets


Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills


Expected learning:

  • Immersive opportunity to apply data science to real-world problem statements in the field of climate change and health 

pecific courses required for project execution:  

  • Any advanced statistics/data science course
